Five new Workflow Builder templates for remote teams
Danny Boyl
21 December 2019

Factors affecting our work settings and daily lives may be beyond our control at the moment, but we can shape how we adapt and improve the way we work together while keeping our teams safe and healthy (we should know, we just had to do the same thing ourselves).


That’s why we’ve created five new templates for Workflow Builder, a visual tool that allows any Slack user to automate routine processes. From streamlining requests to gathering feedback, these templates are designed to make remote work feel like business as usual.


Update teammates on your status


Speaking of making work simpler, we just released a more organized Slack. You can find custom workflows for any channel by clicking the lightning bolt icon at the bottom left of your message box.


Filing and approving requests can be a cumbersome process even when you’re in the office. This workflow provides a customizable template so you can easily track and approve employee requests like expenses or travel. Have you introduced a new request policy and need to update your template? You can edit your workflow in just a few clicks.


Working from home tends to blur the boundaries between our personal and professional lives. You may find yourself hunched on the couch for one too many hours or eating lunch at dinnertime.


When everyone is working from different locations, daily standups are essential for keeping the team aligned. Instead of holding video meetings to list your priorities and blockers, standups can happen in Slack channels—and we have a template for that.

Written by
Danny Boyl
COO at Team INC, Author of upcoming book on Team Management and Leadership
